Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory98.png'}
{3: 'A slimy, sticky crawling sound echoes through the dim room.'}
{3: 'Inside a simple "corral" made of piles of boulders and rebars, a few flora and fauna-like Hetero-Creatures are wandering about.'}
{3: 'The monsters walk past one another without any aggression. Instead, they move together as a group toward the edge of the "corral."'}
{3: 'Within one meter of the corral is a house-cleaning robot that is dead from running out of power.'}
{3: 'The Hetero-Creatures reach out their limbs hysterically at the slumbering machine and keep ramming into the fence that is stopping them.'}
{3: 'Gradually, the commotion slows to a halt.'}
{3: 'Two plant-like Hetero-Creatures extend their "crown" upward and grab onto the highest rebar of the "corral."'}
{3: 'Next, three amphibian-like Hetero-Creatures slowly climb upward along the bodies of their kind.'}
{3: 'After some struggle, they "realize" that the slimy skin of their kind is not suitable for climbing.'}
{3: 'The Hetero-Creature leading the procession extends its concealed blade on its limb and stabs into the body of one of its "friends," pushing this affair up another level.'}
{3: 'When the last Hetero-Creature climbs onto the "branch" leading to the "crown," the thin "branch" finally splits straight down the middle from the weight.'}
{3: 'The unfortunate climber and the two plant-like Hetero-Creatures tumble onto Earth, their crowns still clinging to the top.'}
{3: 'The two Hetero-Creatures that made it over the enclosure close in on their prey and begin their aggressive attack on the silent machine.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cinderelik', 3: 'Sir, a call from Lithos.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory536.jpg', 2: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lithos', 3: 'Gray Raven... they have left, sir.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lithos', 3: 'But they left the "eye," which I asked Mr. Monster to remove.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lithos', 3: 'Everything else... is as you\'ve predicted. Your "cargo" is ready in the paper crane.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: "I don't think we need the batch to know what this means.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lithos', 3: 'Yes, social activity also appeared in City 027.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'That means we should prioritize projects related to Cthylla.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: "We can let Mr. Monster join the project if that's okay with you.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Lithos glances at the man beside her, but he is looking downward and is as quiet as the long winter night.'}
{2: 'Lithos', 3: 'Maybe... meeting him was destiny steering us into the future we see now.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Lithos', 3: "Cinderelik and I couldn't be more thankful for the projects related to Cthylla, but... they might not be the best for you, if I may. Are you sure we want to initiate the backup plan?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: "They are backup plans precisely because they will achieve the results we desire. Don't worry.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lithos', 3: 'Then I know what I should do next... I really hope she will become the "key" that you need.', 4: '1'}
{1: '2', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory536.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cinderelik', 3: 'Are you going to keep observing them?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Cinderelik points at the Hetero-Creatures that are still attacking their prey.'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: "Get rid of them. There's no room for doubt.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cinderelik', 3: 'But only a proportion of samples displayed "cooperative" behaviors.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: "That already proves that it's possible.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'Go and turn them into Earth-like creatures. That will make it easier for Ascendants and humans to understand and manipulate Hetero-Creatures.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'You also need to start preparing items related to Cthylla.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cinderelik', 3: 'Yes, sir...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vonnegut looks at the girl with wings to see if she has any other concerns.'}
{2: 'Cinderelik', 3: '...I was thinking about what Lithos said earlier, that Project Cthylla might not be the best choice for you.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'Because the project will destroy the "original" person in the survivors—and that would mean a higher risk with Haywire.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'That tower is evidence that humans discovered the "key" before us, but lost control of it.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: "If we don't do anything, unusual concentrations of the Punishing Virus will only create more chaotic Hetero-Creatures.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'And creatures created from the Red Tide are difficult to predict and control, like the test samples Lithos left at the Copperfield Aquarium.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: "Confining them to Earth's natural laws before they go Haywire is the better choice for us and for humans.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'So go and make your dream come true.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cinderelik', 3: 'Yes, sir.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory536.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noctis', 3: 'Hey, hey, hey! Over there, over there! Go right over there!', 4: '1'}

{3: 'Behind a scary-looking guy is a group of four or five Hetero-Creatures. After luring the monsters to a specific spot, the muscular Construct gives them an aggressive punch, sending them flying a few meters backward.'}
{3: 'Before the monsters could get back up, they were already engulfed in flames from the explosion.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Mr. Noctis! Too close!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'The explosion! Too close to Commandant!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: 'Huh? There was enough time for 21 to run three laps while carrying Vera!', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'A Construct might be capable of that, but shards from an explosion can totally kill a human!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noctis', 3: "But he's wearing a powered metal suit!", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Well... at least count to three next time before you set off the bomb so people have time to ready themselves!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "Oh! Sure thing! Next time I'll go... three!", 4: '2'}
{3: 'BOOM BOOM—'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Geez, we asked you to count to three, not say three!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "Hahahaha, you moron! Don't you know I don't like to count?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "Just kidding. I set up that one earlier, so that doesn't count. Next time I'll count properly, alright?", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Are you alright, Commandant?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Air reeking of explosives rushes into your lungs as you take a deep breath. A shiver travels down your spine when you realize that it has already been filtered by the powered suit.'}
{3: 'The Cerberus is notorious for their way of executing missions, but the way this particular mad dog pulled off his act just now is way beyond rough.'}
{3: 'With his help, however, you managed to lose a great number of your pursuers just half an hour after leaving City 027.'}

{3: "You encountered some enemies here and there on your way to the Conservation Area where the Cerberus are stationed, but the Hetero-Creatures aren't much of a threat with the three Constructs around."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noctis', 3: 'Is it just me or are these trash harder to get rid of than usual?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "It's not. They are definitely stronger than before.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Are the enemies you fight on your missions also becoming stronger?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "No! That's why I thought I was imagining things—but I think it's time to take my explosives to the next level!", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Does your mission have to do with the Hetero-Creature, too?', 3: '125'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: 'I think so, but not to fight them. Vera is already having a headache dealing with people from the Conservation Area.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Are the people there difficult?', 3: '130'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "How would I know? But Vera hasn't sent me to beat anyone up, so I guess they're okay.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "Oh, shit! Was I supposed to say that? Whatevs... If someone asks, I'll just say the little foolish girl said it.", 4: '2'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: "...Maybe it's a lack of resources?", 3: '134'}
{2: "After we get there, we'll be able to help.", 3: '135'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "Really? Boy, aren't you kind!", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "We've already sent our location to the transport craft. Should we ask them to pick us up later?", 4: '1'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'Yes, I have something of a theory...', 3: '142'}
{2: 'That I might be able to test out at the Conservation Area.', 3: '143'}
{3: 'The sound of explosions and gunshots slowly vanishes—and before you know it, every last one of your pursuers has been eradicated.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noctis', 3: "That's the last of them. Now let's get you to work at the base.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: 'Wait here for a bit. I know a secret shortcut, but let me go check its location.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The muscular Construct sprints straight into the knee-high undergrowth from the large road.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Commandant, what caught your attention exactly?', 4: '1'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'Remember what happened at the stairwell?', 3: '157'}
{2: 'Some Hetero-Creatures committed "suicide" to become stepping stones for the rest to climb.', 3: '158'}
{2: 'And maybe... just maybe...', 3: '159'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Maybe the heaps of Hetero-Creature corpses at the first and second sets of coordinates... are the result of mass suicides?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Right.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "We haven't heard of the enemy committing mass suicides... But let's say this theory was true. Why did they do it?", 4: '2'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'I have no idea.', 3: '166'}
{2: 'But if they actually committed suicide on purpose...', 3: '167'}
{2: "Then I think we're about to see some drastic changes in the battles coming up.", 3: '168'}
{3: 'The desire to survive is in the genes of every creature on Earth.'}
{3: 'It connects every living individual, forming a web that instills the temptation to "live" into every creature.'}
{3: 'Only blinking eyes can behold the beauty of a loved one.'}
{3: 'Only a breathing nose can take in the aroma of delicious food.'}
{3: 'And only moving arms can feel the warmth of another.'}
{3: '"Living" is the only way to experience what life has to offer, and lives on Earth fight endlessly for that right.'}
{3: 'That is also why we remember those who give their lives for others as heroes and their deeds.'}
{3: 'They went against the instinct to avert death, against their nature, against their fears—all for something greater.'}
{3: 'Hetero-Creatures, however, simply live with the need to attack and are unbound by individual worth and the fear of death.'}
{3: 'For them, the strategic goal of the group takes priority, so sacrificing the self to create a bridge is the most sensible choice.'}
{3: 'And that... turned an otherwise disorderly group of individual Hetero-Creatures into an organized troop with absolute execution power.'}
{3: 'Humans have been searching for solutions in waves of disasters with our intelligence and human nature.'}
{3: 'But are we entering another deep winter just as we are turning this war around in this fight for survival?'}
{2: 'But we have to keep in mind the possibility that the Ascendants are behind this.', 3: '185'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Speaking of which... the camera robot is damaged.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Did it capture anything?', 3: '188'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'You could see that the Hetero-Creatures in the area were all moving slowly in the same direction after we left. Then the robot went dead.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'And the work seems a little too neat for it to have been the doing of a Hetero-Creature noticing and immediately destroying the robot.', 4: '1'}
{2: "Just upload the footage. They'll analyze it by frame.", 3: '191'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noctis', 3: 'Hey, Gray Raven! Over here!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Noctis hops down from a tree, crushing a handful of lush vegetation.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Hey, are we going to wade through this meadow?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "Yep, you can't tell there's a path, right? I told you it's a secret shortcut.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: 'Just follow me.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'He strides confidently into the natural sea of green right away.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "...Let's go. Commandant, please follow Liv. I'll be right behind you.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Lee says after a frustrated sigh.'}
{3: 'At the other end of the meadow, with weapons in hand, the humans and Constructs are cutting a path through the tall grass.'}
{3: 'The two groups will soon meet somewhere among the sea of green.'}
